isis.stitle: Recall 98506 - 3800, 4700, and 4900 Series Vehicles with a 1710 Series Driveline and a 12 X 4 Parking Brake

recall.subject: 3800, 4700, and 4900 Series Vehicles with a 1710 Series Driveline and a 12 X 4 Parking Brake

defect.para: This Recall applies to 3800, 4700, and 4900 model vehicles built 7/1/97 through 7/31/98 with a 1710 driveline and a 12 X 4 driveline parking brake.

The DCM parking brake drum can separate from the transmission flange yoke and the transmission companion flange due to an assembly problem. If this condition occurs, the DCM parking brake drum and driveshaft could separate from the vehicle. This defect could cause a vehicular accident without warning which could result in personal injury or property damage, or both.

Owners will be notified of this campaign on their vehicles by Navistar. A listing of owner names and addresses will have been furnished to the involved dealers to enable dealers to follow up with owners to have the vehicles corrected. You must limit the use of this listing to this campaign since the list may contain information obtained from state motor vehicle registration records and the use of such motor vehicle registration data for purposes other than this campaign is a violation of law in several states.

svcproc.title: SERVICE PROCEDURE
svcproc.para: Each vehicle must have the following functional check to determine if the driveline parking brake drum mounting bolts have been properly tightened.

step1.para: Check the torque of the 8 bolts on the transmission yoke flange to the transmission companion flange. The torque must be 34 - 38 lb-ft. If there are no loose bolts, the vehicle is OK and the remaining procedures do not have to be completed. Complete and affix the campaign identification label.
If there are any loose bolts, tighten to 34 - 38 lb-ft, and complete Steps 5 and 6.
Engage the parking brake, then remove the chocks.
Take the vehicle for test drive, and repeat Steps 1 - 5. Complete and affix the campaign identification label.

partsinfo.para: No parts are required unless bolts are damaged. The bolts can be ordered under P/N 25773R1.

note.para: If the bolts are damaged, install new ones using Loctite 242 thread sealant.

entry.para: Inspection of bolts, road test, and retorquing

responuscan.para:
Proceed immediately to make necessary correction to units in inventory. All inventory vehicles subject to this recall campaign must be corrected prior to sale, transfer or delivery.
If vehicles have been sold or transferred and you are in receipt of Customer Notification Letters and Authorization for Recall Service cards for those vehicles, transfer location or customer must be notified from your dealer location. Dealers must correct all vehicles subject to this campaign at no charge to the owner, regardless of mileage, age of vehicle, or ownership, from this time forward.

The National Traffic and Motor Vehicle Safety Act, as amended, provides that each vehicle that is subject to a vehicle recall campaign must be adequately repaired within a reasonable time after the owner has tendered it for repair. A failure to adequately repair within 60 days after a tender of a vehicle is prima facie evidence of failure to repair within a reasonable time. If the condition is not adequately repaired within 60 days, the owner may be entitled to replacement with an identical or reasonable equivalent vehicle at no charge, or to a refund of the purchase price less a reasonable allowance for depreciation.

In order to avoid having to replace an owner vehicle or refund the purchase price, every effort must be made to promptly schedule an appointment with each owner to repair his vehicle as soon as possible.
